articles.description: Jeremy Cowart speaks with Decrypt's Sander Lutz in Nashville ahead of the "Auras" event, in which the noted photographer live-shot 10,000 unique photo-based NFTs in less than 30 minutes. The NFTs will be released through OpenSea on May 9. Video credit: Brett Carlsen for Decrypt

articles.description: When Web3 bug bounty platform Immunefi launched two years ago, CEO and founder Mitchell Amador says the bug bounties weren't great and adoption was slow. But the tides started to turn because even if exploiting a smart contract nets a bigger payday than a bounty, it comes with a huge drawback. "There's a ton of risk when you engage in this, you know, wantonly criminal behavior and steal $200 million from someone else," he said. "There's no way someone's not going to come looking."
articles.title: gm: Meet Immunefi's White Hat Whisperer

articles.description: Lead Mirandus Developer and Gala Games Cofounder Michael McCarthy tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the Web3 MMORPG Mirandus and what its world will be like.
articles.title: Gala Games Co-Founder on Why Mirandus Will Not Have NPCs

articles.description: No panels, no problem. This year's NFC Lisbon from June 7 to June 9 boasts a variety of alternative formats, catering to a decentralized (and sometimes pseudonymous) NFT community. The event also plans to take a closer look into one of the faster-growing niches in NFTs: Photography and what founder John Karp calls "level 2" content. Not to be missed, as NFC Lisbon's media partner, Decrypt will be on-site for all three days. Come say hi!
articles.title: NFC Lisbon Founder John Karp Heralds 'Level 2' Content for 2023 Event

articles.description: Magic Eden Chief Gaming Officer Chris Akhavan tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the NFT marketplace vets potential Web3 games for its platform.
articles.title: How Does Magic Eden Vet Web3 Games?

articles.description: Proof co-founder and CEO Kevin Rose chats with Decrypt Culture Editor Andrew Hayward during NFT NYC 2023 to discuss his startup's reaffirmed focus on digital art and collectors, the challenges of building in the NFT market, and what he's learned in the last year since the buzzy Moonbirds drop.
articles.title: Interview: Kevin Rose on the 'Weird Dynamic' of Building an NFT Project

articles.description: Gala Games Cofounder Michael McCarthy says an "unbelievable" amount of Mirandus conversations are about its approach to Web3 and crypto transactions.
articles.title: How MMORPG Mirandus is Managing its Web3 Elements

articles.title: Aurory Is 'Pokemon Meets The Matrix,' Says Executive Producer

articles.description: There's no doubt that the SEC dealt Kraken—and the outlook for crypto staking products in the U.S.—a big blow when it announced a $30 million settlement and ordered the company to stop offering the service to its customers in the states in February. Now Marco Santori, the company's chief legal officer, says the exchange is eager to move on from it. That means reckoning with a really challenging regulatory environment and growing its customer base overseas. And as Santori quips: "Kraken's master account application has not yet been rejected."
articles.title: gm: Marco Santori

articles.description: XSET gamer and content creator Brycent tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the problem with gaming NFTs—and what needs to happen instead in the next generation of Web3 games.
articles.title: Brycent on Web3 Games and the Problem with 'NFT Value'

articles.description: Azra Games CEO Mark Otero tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his career developing eight RPG games and being acquired by Electronic Arts before getting into Web3.
articles.title: How a Yogurt Shop Started Mark Otero's Video Game Career

articles.description: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his predictions for Web3 gaming in 2023.
articles.title: Blockchain Games Will Shed Their 'Well-Deserved' Bad Reputation In 2023, Says Solana Games Lead

articles.description: Magic Eden Chief Gaming Officer Chris Akhavan talks Web3 adoption and Web3's reputation problem with Decrypt's Kate Irwin. Also, he shares his stance on the word "NFT."
articles.title: We're Going to Stop Calling it Web3 Gaming, Says Magic Eden Chief Gaming Officer

articles.description: At the Game Developer's Conference in San Francisco, Ava Labs' Head of Gaming Ed Chang spoke with Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Ava Labs' approach to Web3 gaming, building games on Avalanche, and gave his thoughts on what the coming months and years will look like for the ecosystem.
articles.title: Ava Labs' Ed Chang on the Future of Web3 Gaming
